result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronall Kyle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges. Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Concurrent with: credit for 400 days time served, concurrent with any other sentence.
*** 11-12-2018/ Judge Cynthia Davis Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include a total of 490 days of sentence credit.***

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronall Kyle

records.addlTxt: Per Remittitur dated December 18, 2018, Appeal Nos.  2016AP001738 CRN, 2016AP001739 CRNM, 2016AP001740 CRNM, (2014CM000047, 2014CF001697, 2014CF002832),  IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on November 6, 2018 that:  IT IS ORDERED that the hold previously imposed in this matter is lifted.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that appellate counsel,  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones, is relieved of any further representation of Ronall Kyle on appeal, effective on the date that an amended judgment of conviction as required by footnote six of this opinion and order is entered in Milwaukee County case No. 2014CF1697.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt:
ORDER AMENDING JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION
On November 6, 2018, the Court of Appeals summarily affirmed the judgments of
conviction in cases 14CM000047, 14CF001697 and 14CF002832 during no-merit proceedings.
1

In footnote six of the decision, the Court of Appeals directed the circuit court to amend the
judgment of conviction in 14CF001697 to include a total of 490 days of sentence credit. The
judgment shall be amended accordingly.
THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall be
amended to include a total of 490 days of sentence credit.

Order: Signed and Filed

per order dated November 6, 2018, Appeal Nos. 2016AP1738-CRNM (2014CM47), 2016AP1739-CRNM (2014CF1697) and 2016AP1740-CRNM (2014CF2832), IT IS ORDERED that the hold previously imposed in these matters is lifted. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are summarily affirmed. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that appellate counsel, Attorney Russell J.A. Jones, is relieved of any further representation of Ronall Kyle on appeal, effective on the date that an amended judgment of conviction as required by footnote six of this opinion and order is entered in Milwaukee County case No. 2014CF1697. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (27 pages) commencing 08/25/2015 received and filed.  CH

Defendant Ronall Kyle in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Ronall Kyle in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  Defendant's MMR date is October 2018.  Additional statement by Teresa T.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 34 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 400 days time served, concurrent with any other sentence.  CONFINEMENT of 16 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Order to Produce for Sentencing Hearing on August 25, 2015 @ 8:15am Received and Filed

Defendant Ronall Kyle in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Ronall Kyle in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-25-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld
